title: We can’t wait to watch these movies and TV shows in 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Robert Pattinson and Zendaya star in 'The Drama,' a movie about a couple facing secrets before marriage, releasing April 3.
'Survivor 50' premieres on February 25 featuring Boston native Charlie Davis competing for the million-dollar prize on CBS.
Christopher Nolan adapts 'The Odyssey' with Matt Damon as Odysseus, with a release date set for July 17.

title: Report: Patriots owner Robert Kraft not selected for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft was not selected for the 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class, falling short of the required votes.
Kraft, the owner since 1994, helped the Patriots claim six Super Bowl titles and 20 division titles.
Kraft and Bill Belichick were among finalists; neither reportedly selected for the Hall of Fame class.

title: Forget the refs. Bruins only have themselves to blame after collapse in Tampa.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins lost to Tampa Bay Lightning 6-5 in a shootout after squandering a 5-1 lead.
Boston struggled with penalties, giving Lightning seven consecutive power plays in a critical game.
Coach Marco Sturm emphasized the need to address discipline issues for playoff viability.

title: How NFL commissioner Roger Goodell reacted to reported Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell denied involvement in Bill Belichick's Hall of Fame snub, clarifying the NFL's non-involvement in the voting process.
Belichick, with six Super Bowl wins, failed to receive the necessary 80% vote for Hall of Fame induction this year.
Goodell confirmed the NFL's role is limited to approving the panel of selectors, emphasizing clarity and fairness in the process.

title: North Andover’s Jake Bobo ready to play ‘bad guy’ against hometown Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jake Bobo, originally from North Andover, is a wide receiver for the Seattle Seahawks facing his hometown Patriots in the Super Bowl.
Bobo, in his third season with Seattle, aims to stop the Patriots from another championship parade, despite his New England roots.
Bobo scored a crucial 17-yard touchdown in the NFC championship game, although his overall playing time has been limited this season.

title: 10 Patriots takeaways from Super Bowl Opening Night
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye reassured fans about his health despite a recent shoulder injury and illness, stating he's ready for the Super Bowl.
Patriots players credit head coach Mike Vrabel for their success, highlighting his impact both on and off the field.
New England embraces the underdog role with Seattle favored by 4.5 points, focusing on self-motivation and defense strategy.

title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, from Newton, allegedly performed unlicensed cosmetic surgery causing permanent damage, facing multiple charges including assault and kidnapping.
Wang allegedly posed as a doctor, performing eyelid surgery with non-FDA-approved fillers and local anesthetic in Allston, prosecutors claim.
Charges include unauthorized practice of medicine and fraudulently obtaining $37,379 by claiming suspended licenses on a loan application.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda broke down on tracks near Plymouth St. in Abington and was hit by an MBTA train.
The 35-year-old driver exited the car before the collision and left the area, according to Transit Police.
No casualties or injuries were reported following the incident, police confirmed.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman walking on Route 28 in Wareham was hit and killed by a Volvo during snowy conditions.
Wareham police responded to the incident after a call at 8:40 p.m. from a Volvo passenger reporting the collision.
The woman and a man used the road due to snow-covered sidewalks; a black truck might have first hit them.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Gloucester officer Alexander Aiello sentenced to 4 years for child pornography charge.
Aiello's devices contained over 200 files of child sexual abuse material, discovered during 2025 investigation.
Aiello, 37, accessed child porn website using Tor Browser; placed on leave prior to charges in May 2025.
